description: The world's greatest underwater prison, also known as the Great Prison or Hell. A massive fortress located in the Calm Belt between Paradise and the New World, designed with multiple underground levels that descend into increasingly harsh conditions.

keyEvents.title: Luffy and Hancock Arrive at Impel Down
keyEvents.description: Luffy and Hancock arrive at the prison, beginning the infiltration mission with only 33 hours until Ace's execution.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the beginning of the Impel Down Arc and Luffy's boldest rescue attempt.

keyEvents.title: Buggy Escapes from Level 1
keyEvents.description: Buggy escapes from his cell on Level 1, demonstrating that even the world's greatest prison can be infiltrated.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the chaos that will unfold during Luffy's infiltration.

keyEvents.title: Minotaurus Suppresses Prison Riot
keyEvents.description: The Minotaurus demonstrates the prison's formidable internal security by crushing a prisoner riot.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the dangerous environment inside Impel Down and the power of its Jailer Beasts.

features.description: The prison consists of multiple levels descending underground, each with increasing levels of torture and harsh conditions.
All Devil Fruit users entering Impel Down must wear Seastone handcuffs to nullify their powers during security checks.
The prison employs Jailer Beasts - massive awakened Zoan-type Devil Fruit users - to suppress riots and guard prisoners.
Located in the Calm Belt, the prison is naturally protected by Sea Kings, making escape nearly impossible.
All visitors, regardless of status, must undergo thorough security searches conducted by prison staff.

culturalSignificance: Impel Down represents the World Government's ultimate expression of justice and punishment. Its reputation as inescapable makes it a symbol of the government's power and control.

statusHistory.description: Operating as the World Government's maximum security prison

trivia: Impel Down's design is inspired by Dante's Inferno, with each level representing a deeper circle of hell.
The prison's location in the Calm Belt means there are no ocean currents, making it extremely difficult to reach or escape from.
Despite being called the 'inescapable prison,' Luffy's infiltration and the mass breakout will challenge this reputation.

description: Marine Headquarters, the central command of the Marines. The location where Ace's public execution is scheduled to take place.

keyEvents.title: 33 Hours Until Ace's Execution at Marineford
keyEvents.description: The episode establishes that Ace will be publicly executed at Marineford in 33 hours, setting up the impending war.
keyEvents.significance: Creates the urgent time constraint and foreshadows the massive battle that will occur at Marineford.

culturalSignificance: Marine Headquarters represents the World Government's military might and serves as the stage for public displays of justice.
